member.name: P:CYQ.Data.AppConfig.DB.FilterSqlInjection
member.summary: MAction所有操作中的where条件，默认有超强的过滤单词，来过滤Sql注入关键字，如果语句包含指定的过滤词，则会返回错误信息，并记录日志。 如果需要自定义关键字，可配置此项，如：“delete;from,truncate，其它单词”，分号表词组，需要同时包含两个词； 多个过滤词组以","逗号分隔

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.GetInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Static method for getting an instance. This method will first check for named instances that has been set up programmatically. If no such instance exists, it will check the "beitmemcached" section of the standard config file and see if it can find configuration info for it there. If that also fails, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.hash(System.String)
member.summary: Private key hashing method that uses the modified FNV hash.

member.summary: Private hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: The user-supplied hash value to hash.

member.summary: Private multi-hashing method for user-supplied hash values.
member.param: An array of keys to hash.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.checkKey(System.String)
member.summary: Private key-checking method. Throws an exception if the key does not conform to memcached protocol requirements: It may not contain whitespace, it may not be null or empty, and it may not be longer than 250 characters.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Set(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "set" command in the memcached protocol. It will unconditionally set the given key to the given value. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully set.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "add" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key does not already exist. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully added.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Replace(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "replace" command in the memcached protocol. It will set the given key to the given value only if the key already exists. Using the overloads it is possible to specify an expiry time, either relative as a TimeSpan or absolute as a DateTime. It is also possible to specify a custom hash to override server selection. This method returns true if the value was successfully replaced.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Get(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "get" command in the memcached protocol. It will return the value for the given key. It will return null if the key did not exist, or if it was unable to retrieve the value. If given an array of keys, it will return a same-sized array of objects with the corresponding values. Use the overload to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "delete" command in the memcache protocol. It will immediately delete the given key and corresponding value. Use the overloads to specify an amount of time the item should be in the delete queue on the server, or to specify a custom hash to override server selection.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.FlushAll
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "flush_all" command in the memcached protocol. When this method is called, it will send the flush command to all servers, thereby deleting all items on all servers. Use the overloads to set a delay for the flushing. If the parameter staggered is set to true, the client will increase the delay for each server, i.e. the first will flush after delay*0, the second after delay*1, the third after delay*2, etc. If set to false, all servers will flush after the same delay. It returns true if the command was successful on all servers.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Stats
member.summary: This method corresponds to the "stats" command in the memcached protocol. It will send the stats command to all servers, and it will return a Dictionary for each server containing the results of the command.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.Status
member.summary: This method retrives the status from the serverpool. It checks the connection to all servers and returns usage statistics for each server.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.KeyPrefix
member.summary: If you specify a key prefix, it will be appended to all keys before they are sent to the memcached server. They key prefix is not used when calculating which server a key belongs to.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.SendReceiveTimeout
member.summary: The send receive timeout is used to determine how long the client should wait for data to be sent and received from the server, specified in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The connect timeout is used to determine how long the client should wait for a connection to be established, specified in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.MinPoolSize
member.summary: The min pool size determines the number of sockets the socket pool will keep. Note that no sockets will be created on startup, only on use, so the socket pool will only contain this amount of sockets if the amount of simultaneous requests goes above it. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: The max pool size determines how large the socket connection pool is allowed to grow. There can be more sockets in use than this amount, but when the extra sockets are returned, they will be destroyed. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.SocketRecycleAge
member.summary: If the pool contains more than the minimum amount of sockets, and a socket is returned that is older than this recycle age that socket will be destroyed instead of put back in the pool. This allows the pool to shrink back to the min pool size after a peak in usage. The default value is 30 minutes.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MemcachedClient.CompressionThreshold
member.summary: If an object being stored is larger in bytes than the compression threshold, it will internally be compressed before begin stored, and it will transparently be decompressed when retrieved. Only strings, byte arrays and objects can be compressed. The default value is 1048576 bytes = 1MB.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.Dispose
member.summary: Disposing of a PooledSocket object in any way causes it to be returned to its SocketPool.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.Close
member.summary: This method closes the underlying stream and socket.

member.summary: Writes a string to the socket encoded in UTF8 format.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.Write(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Writes an array of bytes to the socket and flushes the stream.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads from the socket until the sequence '\r\n' is encountered, and returns everything up to but not including that sequence as a UTF8-encoded string 返回Null即没有数据了！

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.ReadResponse
member.summary: Reads a response line from the socket, checks for general memcached errors, and returns the line. If an error is encountered, this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.Read(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Fills the given byte array with data from the socket.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.SkipToEndOfLine
member.summary: Reads from the socket until the sequence '\r\n' is encountered.

member.summary: Resets this PooledSocket by making sure the incoming buffer of the socket is empty. If there was any leftover data, this method return true.

member.name: P:CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket.IsAlive
member.summary: Checks if the underlying socket and stream is connected and available.

member.summary: 备份的Socket池，如果某主机挂了，在配置了备份的情况下，会由备份Socket池提供服务。

member.summary: Internal constructor. This method takes the array of hosts and sets up an internal list of socketpools.

member.summary: Given an item key hash, this method returns the socketpool which is closest on the server key continuum.

member.summary: This method executes the given delegate on a socket from the server that corresponds to the given hash. If anything causes an error, the given defaultValue will be returned instead. This method takes care of disposing the socket properly once the delegate has executed.

member.summary: The SocketPool encapsulates the list of PooledSockets against one specific host, and contains methods for acquiring or returning PooledSockets.

member.name: F:CYQ.Data.Cache.SocketPool.socketPoolBak
member.summary: 备份的Socket池，如果某主机挂了，在配置了备份的情况下，会由备份Socket池提供服务。 （问题：主SocketPool怎么找到对应的备份？）

member.name: F:CYQ.Data.Cache.SocketPool.deadEndPointSecondsUntilRetry
member.summary: If the host stops responding, we mark it as dead for this amount of seconds, and we double this for each consecutive failed retry. If the host comes alive again, we reset this to 1 again.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.SocketPool.getEndPoint(System.String)
member.summary: This method parses the given string into an IPEndPoint. If the string is malformed in some way, or if the host cannot be resolved, this method will throw an exception.

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.SocketPool.Acquire
member.summary: Gets a socket from the pool. If there are no free sockets, a new one will be created. If something goes wrong while creating the new socket, this pool's endpoint will be marked as dead and all subsequent calls to this method will return null until the retry interval has passed. 这个方法扩展（备份链接池）

member.name: M:CYQ.Data.Cache.SocketPool.Return(CYQ.Data.Cache.MSocket)
member.summary: Returns a socket to the pool. If the socket is dead, it will be destroyed. If there are more than MaxPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will be destroyed. If there are less than MinPoolSize sockets in the pool, it will always be put back. If there are something inbetween those values, the age of the socket is checked. If it is older than the SocketRecycleAge, it is destroyed, otherwise it will be put back in the pool.
